frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
An Obstruction blocks an Eclipsed entity partially or completely from view.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
A  Counter_actor or Cause  impedes an Agent in an Activity or impedes the unfolding or continuation of a State_of_affairs.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
frameExamples: Therefore, as I passed the school, I <t>hid</t> the gun and holster in the mailbox
Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
A small green bulb <t>concealed</t> behind the panel flashed on momentarily .
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.

However, as this story goes on the Queen of Sodom has a brother who
plans to <t>undermine</t> his sister and take the throne of Sodom.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is the entity which is blocked from view.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
The location in which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
<fen>Time</fen> denotes the interval of time during which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become hidden from perceptual access.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The entity which blocks the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity from view.
The entity which is blocked from view.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
An event or state_of_Affairs that successfully impedes an <fen>Agent</fen> or a State_of_affairs.
A person who intentionally or not acts in such a way that an <fen>Agent</fen> or State_of_affairs is impeded.
A person who is intentionally engaged in some <fen>Activity</fen> and who is impeded in that <fen>Activity</fen>.
An <fen>Activity</fen> that is being impeded.
A state or event that is ongoing and whose continuance or unfolding is impeded.
The time at which the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> works agains the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> subverts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
listRoleExamples:
Michael Jackson gave wine to the 13-year-old cancer patient at the center of
the molestation charges he's battling but concealed <fex>it</fex> inside a Coke can.
<fex>The deputy</fex> concealed the bayonet under his coat.
He had concealed the necklace <fex>behind him</fex>.
The mists obscured <fex>the top of the tower</fex>.
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
Tory rebels queued to warn that <fex>they</fex> wouldsabotage efforts to put the treaty through Parliament .
If he is really undermining <fex>me</fex>, then he is a fine friend.
The Dominican Republic was widely held to have undermined <fex>its own efforts to become a full member of CARICOM</fex>
Whenever I try to quit they all try to sabotage <fex>my efforts</fex>.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
